title: @Riot New Graves Splash Art - Tobacco
body:
While it fits his theme, It's still bad Riot is promoting smoking indirectly.

His old splash art did not have him smoking tobacco.

This is probably going to be ignored but I thought i'd throw it out there.

replies.body: They all promote violence if that's the case
Does that mean that {{champion:79}} Gragas promotes drinking?

So, people got tired of whinning about sexualized female Champions and now jumped onto other subjects?

LB's splash art promotes cloning, rito pls, you're hurting my feelings.
I'm sorry, how is it promoting smoking? NOTHING in the splash art says to go smoke tobacco or do anything with it in general as well as it not saying that it's good or bad.

To be fair, the depiction of characters in public media doing an action is considered promotion of that action. I don't know your age, but in the 90's a ban was laid down that stated characters in shows that aired during certain times of day and movies with ratings lower than PG-13 could not be shown smoking - because children are impressionable. This game is marketed to older teens and it's a different world now.

It's unlikely that anyone today is going to say "I wanna smoke so I can be cool like Graves!" but the OP is not completely wrong, either.
He smoked a cigar in the New Dawn cinematic. If anything, Graves should be smoking in-game, too.
By this logic Cho'Gath promotes eating human flesh.

{{item:3160}} {{champion:104}} 

I don't always smoke, but when I do, I choose Feral brand cigars.

and how do you know it's tobacco... he could be smoking hemp or something else. why are you jumping to conclusion i'ts a video game. in that case GTA v should not be sold to anyone under 18. because of the nudity, violence, drugs, and alcohol usage in the game but i know kids under 10 that play it so get off your high horse and realize it's just a game. Games don't turn you into anything it is your choice. video games don't twist anyone's arm to do anything.
